reviews.text:
The three stars is really because of The lack of hospitality. Our waiter was not attentive, had two separate staff bring what we needed 1.the Bus boy brought us toast and 2.another waiter had to bring my refill apple juice. He didn‚Äôt even bother to give us eye contact or access but walked past us 4-5 times not once did he ask Is everything OK? Instead he yell
To us ‚Äúdid we get everything ‚Äú The lady at the cashier desk was apologetic and gave us cookies for the poor service
Short ribs were good, calimari cooked well but stale, new England clam chowder quite salty. Nice parking lot in back. Entrance to lot difficult to see.

Came here since we were close by and wanted breakfast. First time. Food was decent no complaints there and service was average. What bothered me was at the end when our bill came the waitress added herself a tip without asking on my card. We usually leave cash tips but when she brought back my receipt the tip was already charged. I had my family there so I did not want to argue and left. I‚Äôll be disputing the charges with my bank. Unless stated you don‚Äôt auto add tip. The receipt had the name of Kim. She was a blonde kinda tall lady.

I have been going to this diner since I was 16 yrs. old. Always the best food and service, my favorite waitress is Kim McGee. She is so efficent, kind and always a smile on her face. Ask for her, and you will be very happy!
It's a wonderful place to bring your family to.

Man, I really miss the old spot‚Äîbut this location totally hits the same! I went for the first time recently, and the experience was just as great. Even though it was busy (Sunday at 11:45AM with a party of 6), we were seated quickly. The hostess was super sweet, and what seemed to be the manager was just as lovely.

Some of us went for breakfast‚Äîthe waffles & over-easy eggs were perfect. Great flavor, fresh, and cooked just right. My brother (a fancy foodie) got the buffalo chicken wrap and said it was amazing. My husband had the Reuben and he too was impressed.

So glad I made it back‚Äîcan‚Äôt wait to return again soon. Honestly, I‚Äôd go back just for the waffles!

The Georgia Diner is absolutely fantastic!!! the food is always fresh, flavorful, and served with a smile.  The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, making every visit feel like coming home! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
The food is simply amazing, great serving and the atmosphere so warm and nice!

The food is so varied and anything I ‚Äòve tried so far is really good and worths every dollar!
The staff is super friendly and nice
Ample parking, decent food, excellent service
I ordered a chicken salad wrap and it was kinda bad. The attention it wasn‚Äôt good at all.
Excellent food and service!
Going here for years ... food is always awesome.
My cousin ordered challah french toast with bacon and I had the 2 eggs over hard with cornbeef hash and

This is a comfortable dining spot. Good atmosphere, good lighting. I visited twice recently after I hadn't been there for awhile, since they first relocated to their current location. I ordered the Cheeseburger deluxe, which was great and it comes with steak fries. Steak fries are the best, very classic but believe it or not, not everyone has tried steak fries. I dined in and ordered an iced coffee as well. On the second visit I stopped by to get something to go, I selected a brownie and a chocolate mouse cake. They were both good and better than store bought of course.
Love the Georgia everyone is nice and it's very comfortable place to eat
Great food!

This diner stands out because the decor/atmosphere and the great service. First time was on a busy Saturday morning for brunch. Once I entered I felt transported to a different time. It almost feels like I walked into a movie set. It‚Äôs just feels like how a diner should feel.
Waiter Jas seemed to be working several tables by himself but was very respectful and didn‚Äôt rush us at all. Extremely professional. 10/10.
I ordered the chef‚Äôs omelette which was mediocre (3.5/5) - my boyfriend said his pancakes, sausage and eggs were good. Steer clear of the corned beef hash unless you like oily mushes.

Would return.
I woke up craving woffles! Georgia dinner hit that craving out of the park!!! ü•∞‚òïüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüOmg sooo good! Thank you!!!
Everything was great. Retiree Luncheon

Had breakfast with my daughter.This is my go to diner.I've been coming here at the previous location for  over twenty years, it never disappoints. Everyone's always very friendly. The food is your typical diner food. But made very well always, as ordered
Dictated to any allergies or specific dietary needs, I would recommend if you haven't been there and you're looking for a quick breakfast lunch or dinner
A little dirty, the lamps and mirrors, food was ok we ordered apple pancakes (needs more cinnamon) the grilled chicken wrap was very simple, omelets where very good.
Average diner. Good menu.

This a old school establishment I have been going to forever. I normally have breakfast there no matter what time of day I go. The burgers and the breakfast have never failed me. They got my order wrong and were very cool about correcting the order a neighborhood classic
Brought back family memories...
Outstanding and simply stated AWESOME. The staff the FOOD [U do get your MONEYS WORTH!] My NO.1 go to DINER.

The ambiance and crowd changed after COVID, it used to be more buzzing and rowdy on a Friday...Food still as good as it was 40 years ago when I first start coming here with friends that live in Elmhurst and Jackson Heights
We have been going to this place for many years. It is ok for breakfast. Coffee is good for a diner.
Food was ok
Love the food and service here always top notch!!! Been my go to for many years and will be for many years more
Great people and managers
The waiter brought my order & disappeared! I had to ask twice for napkins & more coffee. Place needs Updated seating.
Everything on the menu is good. Service is attentive. Prices have gone up
The food was great and staff was very friendly.
Fast service and good food.
Stop for late night meal. Ordered challah french toast & got white bread.
They did not celebrate my birthday even I told them :(

Service was Good
It was a Sunday late afternoon...
So there was no wait to b seated
There were 3 of us
The food was good
I would go there again if I was in the Neighborhood
Great service and food
Going there a long time and never had a bad meal or service.

Nothing wrong with this diner. There‚Äôs a large variety of average food. Good place to get breakfast and to accommodate large crowds. The staff is very nice. We came last minute for a birthday celebration because the other place had a reserved party. There‚Äôs plenty of parking.
Old school diner with parking.

This might be the most underrated diner in NYC!

I‚Äôve always loved coming to this diner in Queens for breakfast, but I finally tried their lunch and dinner menu and I was blown away. These dishes seriously look like they belong in a fine dining restaurant!

From juicy filet mignon and flavorful chicken pomodoro to crispy soft shell crabs, baked salmon, and crab claws plus diner classics like chocolate chip pancakes and a waffle sundae, this spot does it all! Every dish and baked good here is made fresh daily and from scratch!

Whether you‚Äôre craving seafood, steak, or sweet breakfast bites, this Queens diner is a must-visit!

I‚Äôve been coming here since I was a little kid. The food has stayed consistently great, the service is always accommodating and the interior is timeless. Like everything prices have gone up, but unlike a lot of things the price is worth it.
$10.00 for a small side of French fries, what, when and where have you seen anything like this? I understand inflation is a thing but this absolutely ridiculous!!!!

I‚Äôve been coming to Georgia Diner since I was a kid, and it still feels like home every time I walk in. The staff always greets you with a smile, the service is consistent, and the food hits every single time. It‚Äôs one of those rare places where the quality hasn‚Äôt changed if anything, it‚Äôs only gotten better.

No matter how much changes in the neighborhood, Georgia Diner remains a comforting constant. A true gem in Queens. OH LAWD!
Loved it!
Great Diner!
Quality food at a hefty price. Ambiance is nice. Loved the pancakes and lunch menu. They give crayons and coloring materials for waiting.

Ï†ÄÎÖÅÏãùÏÇ¨Î•º ÏπúÍµ¨ÏôÄÌñàÎäîÎç∞
ÏùåÏãùÏù¥ ÏïÑÏ£º ÎßõÏûàÍ≥†,ÏπúÏ†àÌï®

A food companion suggested we check out Georgia Diner since it was nearby our destination. I ordered the corned beef hash with two sunny side up eggs as it is my bench mark meal to order at a diner I have never been to. As suspected, it was prepared in the typical diner way and satisfied my morning hunger. The coffee was solid too, as you really can‚Äôt go wrong with diner coffee.

What unexpectedly stole the show was the doily under the coffee cup. Easily the nicest, highest quality doily I‚Äôve ever seen. It was such a small touch, but it really stood out.

The ambiance was casual and relaxed, and the service was friendly and efficient. If you‚Äôre in the area and looking for a dependable, no-frills diner, Georgia Diner delivers.
Excelente lugar, desayunos deliciosos. Me gustaron los egos Benedict y el Irish Brakfast. S√∫per recomendado, personal amable y atento. Muchas gracias por la atenci√≥n recibida.

Georgia Diner is a classic diner that serves classic specials and dishes and has the same old-timey diner feel, but quite frankly, doesn‚Äôt hold up to the expectations of a good diner.

The food was honestly just average, and considering the price, I‚Äôm tempted to say that it wasn‚Äôt really worth it. I ordered the corned beef hash and eggs, which comes with toast and potatoes, and it was honestly not that great. It was average-tasting hash that you can get from a can, and the potatoes on the side were slightly undercooked. for the price of 18$, it wasn‚Äôt that great. The rest of my table‚Äôs dishes were just average, but considering the price, it brings the rating down a bit.

The service was decent, and our waiter/busboy were attentive enough, but nothing too out of the ordinary. I will complain though, that an 18% tip was automatically added to our bill. Perhaps it was because I had a large party, but that certainly was unexpected as no one and nothing on the menu mentioned that.

The atmosphere was decent, having that classic diner feel. the bathrooms weren‚Äôt that clean, but there was nothing too bad. On a positive note, there were cookies at the register which really brought me back to other classic diners.

One final complaint is that there are two separate prices for cash and credit, with the credit being higher. If you do come, try to bring some cash.

overall, Georgia Diner is decent but nothing stands out too much, and my complaints of the pricing, food, and tip put my rating lower.  Not the worst diner I‚Äôve been to, but not the best either.

Always love discovering a new diner and in this case it‚Äôs a new diner that is over 40 years of histroy slinging out everything from breakfast, staples to innovative, high-end dinner, dishes, and everything in between.

Tried their famous breakfast on a weekday and was not disappointed. Everything from the Benedict to the breakfast burger, and even the freshness of the coffee in that old-school diner vibe was perfect

I wish there was a 3.5 rating available.   As a veteran of MANY diners, this one was unremarkable.   That does not mean bad, but not acceptional in any way.   The good: I went looking for a place to eat that had a parking lot.  Georgia Diner has a BIG ONE.   This eatery is old and shows it inside and out.   As a matter of fact, once I started walking from my car, I had second thoughts about eating there.  It looks old and minimally maintained to me.  Inside, it is deceptively large.   On a diet,  I only glanced at the deserts up front.   Typical Diner choices.   Ordered and pictured  was a grilled chicken salad and the Greek gyro without the white sauce.   The salad got rave reviews from my friend.   The chicken breast was cooked well and juicy.  My gyro actually concerned me a little bit.  The lettuce and tomatoes looked not spoiled but not the freshest either.  The gyro meat had strange light colored circles in it.  I know the meat is processed, but I had never seen   it look so unappealing before.   Whatever it was, it was not bad  but not great either.   As I looked at other meals being delivered, they all seemed large and well adorned.   The service was adequate.   Nice enough lady and no gaps in service.
The bathroom was not dirty but  not fresh.   The floor was sticky like the last show at a movie theater.  This really turned me off.  The two meals were a modest $35, which these you get what you pay for I recon.  I certainly would not rush back there myself.   Your mileage may vary...

***Don‚Äôt miss this hidden gem***. This was an insider tip by an uncle that has lived in queens all his life. The service was exceptional, there is something absolutely endearing about the homely atmosphere and the friendly service.

The food was freshly made, nothing seemed coming from a plastic bag. They have a large menu, I went for the Reuben sandwich and it did not disappoint.

This is a very busy diner on the weekend, and even so, we were seated very quickly. The food was on point for breakfast  and I had to try the pi√±a colada which was excellent. We had the Chicken Fingers with waffles and Chocolate Chip Pancakes with whipped cream.

Pretty nice diner off Queens Boulevard. Large parking area. Seated immediately by a well dressed fellow at a long booth. Coffee was hot and fresh and the cup was bottomless. Food was plentiful and delicious. Menu has two columns of prices, one for cash and one for credit cards. Good idea. ‚ôøÔ∏è.

We went out for breakfast as a family, and unfortunately, the experience wasn‚Äôt great. The cup I was served coffee in had a visible lipstick stain, which clearly shows it wasn‚Äôt properly washed before being used again.

We also noticed that the windows were quite dirty, which gives a poor overall impression of the place. Cleanliness in a food establishment should be a basic priority‚Äîboth in the utensils and the environment.

It‚Äôs a shame, because the place has potential, but details like this make it hard to feel comfortable or confident eating there. I truly hope they improve these aspects, because cleanliness is not optional‚Äîit‚Äôs essential.
On a rainy day I ordered a hot chocolate, but it‚Äôs not a creamy or tasty chocolaYou. The space is beautiful, the service is good.

Great local diner.

Interior seating are was great and very neat & tidy. Bathrooms are dated and could use a rehab.

Food and service was great. Wait staff very friendly.

Big signs on the front door indicating that Covid vaccination proof before entry was required but when you enter there is no check for any Covid vaccination.

I ordered a grilled chicken wrap. The wrap was very good although on the small side for the price. I also got sweet potato fries which I enjoyed. The diner has lots of seating and a large parking lot. The menu is large with a wide variety for every meal.

Georgia's Diner has been a neighborhood staple for years, offering a nostalgic charm that keeps people coming back. It used to be the go-to spot for a late-night bite, especially if you were craving a simple sandwich. While the food is not exactly gourmet, it's decent and satisfying, and the menu is impressively large, covering everything from sandwiches and pasta to breakfast classics. You can find just about anything you're in the mood for. Overall, it's a nostalgic experience, but don't expect a culinary masterpiece--just familiar, comforting diner fare.

The food was wonderful. The Ruben was really good The bread nice buttery and toasted.

One thing I didn't get to take a picture of was their cake selection. So many desserts to choose from.

One thing about the Georgia Diner would be to come hungry because they are very generous on the servings

This is an iconic place which looks weird from outside but every weekend it‚Äôs parking is so busy that we decided to give it a chance. The dirty waiter serves carelessly food. Portions are big, however the quality of products is bad. We will probably never comeback.

Negative 5 star, but I am forced to give 1 star and here is why.

The service was ok, but the two waiters didn‚Äôt refill our cups of water quick enough. We were definitely thirsty.

We were happy that they were able to accommodate 22 people but oh my, I do not recommend the Alfredo fettuccine, one guest had chicken and one had shrimp and both said the sauce was not good at all. The Alfredo tasted like expired curd cheese.

One guest ordered a burger and didn‚Äôt get his beef! How does one mess up an order like that? But they did replace the order quickly.

The fries were not good. The kids didn‚Äôt even finish when they usually do.

One guest had a Cobb salad and also was not impressed. They ended up not taking anything home and left hungry.

Very disappointed. Would not recommend.

A very comforting, old-timey diner feel. When you go to a diner, you know exactly what you're looking for: comfy booths, tasty smells of food in the air, and a hot beverage.

This diner provided all of that.
Ordered the Irish Breakfast and a cup of tea.

While the service took a significant amount of time, the food was fresh and the home-fries were actually good (not wet at all, browned decently, and great for soaking up egg yolks from sunny side up eggs).
The black pudding and the white pudding made great accompaniments to the ham, the eggs, and the tomatoes.

While it took some time to get anyone to get the check, overall, the food and atmosphere make for a superb diner experience. Overall: 8.4/10

I love this diner! I know it was across the street before and it replaced Pops diner and it‚Äôs been a top 5 favorite diner‚Äôs in NYC for me. I always come here for either breakfast or lunch and sometimes dinner. Can never go wrong getting their breakfast and their burgers are so freaking good. My friend had gotten a penne a la vodka with grilled chicken and she liked it! I just forgot to take a picture of it because I was so hungry and excited for my burger lol. I‚Äôve come here many years and I was never served sliced bread until this time. It was served fresh and so soft! I was impressed ‚Ä¶even came with breadsticks and crackers in the basket! My go to diner in queens! If you‚Äôre having a drunken night or having the munchies...def should come here! Always so clean and the staff is always attentive. They even have a parking lot which comes in handy being on Queens Blvd.

not a bad place with its own Parking, which is good. The prices are moderate, somehow everything is very sad and dull inside. Sad and tired waiters in dirty suits. Replace both waiters and costumes. And at the same time, the dishes, which have already gone for the second decade, feel like. There were remnants of water on the spoon. Why they don't listen in the dryer before serving it to customers is a big question. I rate the institution by 4 points

So my husband took me out for dinner because I was having a hard day. We had heard about a lobster special and shellfish is my jam! We waited a while for a server to greet us, and when he did he quickly took our order and ran away. Although he did come back to ask if I wanted my lobster steamed or stuffed. I chose stuffed and I swear that crab stuffing was phenomenal. My main issue was the lack of follow up. We had to flag down a busser for water refills, everything was salty like I like but water is a necessity. Then after we were done eating (and looking for him for 20 min) my husband caught our waiters attention to ask for the check and he acknowledged then went into the kitchen for about 15 minutes. He just seemed to have checked out. Also, don‚Äôt order the chili, it was weirdly sweet and gave us horrible gas pains.

Been going to Georgia for years, pictured is the chef's salad. There doesn't appear to be a budget lunch special anymore, though all the items are still in the main menu. There is a daily special from noon till 10PM, though this contains a selection of dinner entrees, which comes with a soup or salad. The pictured menu was for Wednesday, when I visited. A coffee is $3.25

The staff is decent, the place is clean, and the service is quick. I went there with my friend and the food came out in reasonable time without the long wait. Their pancakes are soft and easy to cut and their food is good. I also requested‚Ä¶

Plenty of free parking. Waiter seemed annoyed & was bit rude immediately. The Chicken & Waffles was very dry & bland. Some of the chicken was so thin the texture was awful. The cuppacino was bland. The restaurant looked nice inside but overall had a weird vibe with the mood of the overall staff. My waiter never even came to check on me until I was done eating. Waste of money.

Georgia Diner is a great family-friendly spot, always busy on Sundays. I usually go for breakfast, but their dinner is great too. The service is warm and hospitable, and the atmosphere is really nice. Definitely try the strawberry cheesecake, it‚Äôs fresh, creamy, and absolutely delicious!

came here with my family on a busy morning, but we were seated immediately and the service was amazing! really appreciated the lady that helped my family and i she was generous and patient, the food was really really good my family loved every bite the omelettes, bec, pancakes, french toast and coffee were amazing! definitely recommend with family and friends.

This place used to be one of the best dinners in Queens. Now days not anymore. Went for breakfast ordered vegetables omelette with mushrooms, tomatoes and spinach. Spinach was ok but no mushrooms and tomatoes. In the coffee found piece of paper at the bottom. Spoken to manager who could not to listen to me giving his ideas about coffee with paper. Very disappointed üòû

Used to come here a lot as a kid in the 90s and always visit when I come back to town. I miss the old location and the atmosphere isn‚Äôt the same. I went there last weekend and it was just ok. The food and service wasn‚Äôt as good as it used to be.

One of the best diners is in Queens. Not only is the service great, but the location is great with a large parking lot. I cannot leave out the creamy, tasty Strawberry Shortcake, it's a must on your way out the door.
Fresh food and delicious! However, staff/waiters seem to be annoyed. That was the vibe. Otherwise, the food was good. Hot chocolate was on point!

Make sure you check all the prices on the menu first! They will charge extra for everything.

First, the waitress Silvia was rude. She gave us cold coffee and when we asked why, she said "that's what's in the pot". She didn't even try to fix it. Then we ordered French toast and strawberries, which was already 16 dollars for 2 pieces, and we asked for turkey sausage, and they charged 8 dollars! 8 dollars I've never seen that. For 3 little pieces of sausage. And an extra 4 dollars for the turkey bacon my mom asked for with her order. We proceeded to speak to the manager, and he did not even care. When my father went to speak to him about the other extra charge after, he dismissed him and said he had already spoken to the lady (me) and didn't even hear him out came back to our table took the bill angrily and took off the Turkey sausage. If you don't care about your customers, why work in a restaurant. Disgusting service. Our first time there and we won't be back! The diner wasn't even busy and 3:30 pm.

A very typical diner with great menu selections. Normally, I don‚Äôt like to go to diner but wanted to give this a try, since we always pass by here on our way back from Queens Blvd. As a party of 2 adults and 1 preschooler, we got waffle with chicken tenders (the tenders were amazingly juicy), salad(forgot what we got but the portion size was WOW), sausage & eggs, mussel pasta, clam chowder, cappuccino, all come with very big portion and we also got bread for free. All three of us left with very full stomach and had to get to go, we did order a lot though. Honestly the food wasn‚Äôt that great great but definitely above average and beyond my expectation. The bill was surprisingly reasonable, with all these, we ended up paying $80ish. Will def return.

Like going here during a weerkday evening...after work to grab dinner.  The food was good -the staff is always super friendly and accommodating.  I like that it's a big place so you don't have to sit too close to others (partitions between booths) or even wait long for a table.

Update: Also, a great place to go for a quick late meal / snack on a Saturday night.  Large diner plenty of seating and they're super accommodating for picky eaters.

Layout/atmosphere
*Georgia peach sign/logo out front/on top; large space; counter/bakery display in front; booths to left; tables/booths to right; parking lot

Service
*Solid

Food/drink
*Athenian Omelette (Spinach & Feta Cheese) with home fries - good
*Corn Muffin (toasted) with butter & jelly - good

I've been here a few of times and it has always been good until today July 5th 230pm. My waiters of middle eastern ethnicity was my waiters and I must say he is a total mess, the only reason the only thing that was good was the clam chowder is because that probably wasn't made by the waiter or chef and it comes from a bag. The waiter doesn't know the difference between a chicken souvlali and a gyro is yet he tried to convince me they are the same. Now both are made with chunks of skewered chicken but they gave me a grilled chicken in a gyro when all I wanted was a chicken souvlaki platter, my wife ordered a cheeseburger and brought her a dried piece of meat with cheese on burger bread, no lettuce, no tomatoes, mayo, no fries with her platter, the carbonara was bad, we got a plate of fruits with yogurt, honey and walnuts for my baby and requested fruits and yogurt in separate plate and the guy brought it all together. Horrible experience, waiter and chef should be oriented If not fired. I should have known better when I saw the person next to me when they left their food on the plate.

The Best üëå of the Best in Queens
...No doubt- food is spectacular  - of High quality  - service, management & wait staff dressed very neat.
